name: Radiohead
about: Radiohead are an English rock band from Abingdon, Oxfordshire, formed in 1985. The band consists of Thom Yorke, Jonny Greenwood, Colin Greenwood, Phil Selway and Ed O'Brien.

name: Beach Boys
about: The Beach Boys are an American rock band, formed in Hawthorne, California in 1961. The group's original lineup consisted of brothers Brian, Dennis and Carl Wilson, their cousin Mike Love, and their friend Al Jardine.

name: Marvin Gaye
about: Marvin Gaye was an American singer, songwriter, and musician. Gaye helped to shape the sound of Motown in the 1960s

name: Johnny Cash
about: Cash was an American singer-songwriter, actor, and author, widely considered one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century.

name: Michael Jackson
about: Called the King of Pop,Jackson was an American singer, songwriter, record producer, dancer, and actor.

name: Nirvana
about: Nirvana was an American rock band that was formed by singer and guitarist Kurt Cobain and bassist Krist Novoselic in Aberdeen, Washington, in 1987. Drummer Dave Grohl later joined.

name: Bruce Springsteen
about: An American musician, singer, songwriter and humanitarian. He is best known for his work with his E Street Band.

name: Jay-Z
about: Shawn Corey Carter, known by his stage name Jay Z, is an American rapper, record producer, and entrepreneur. He is one of the most financially successful hip hop artists and entrepreneurs in America.

name: Nine Inch Nails
about: Nine Inch Nails is an American industrial rock band, founded in 1988 by Trent Reznor.

name: Led Zeppelin
about: Led Zeppelin were an English rock band formed in London in 1968. The group consisted of guitarist Jimmy Page, singer Robert Plant, bassist and keyboardist John Paul Jones, and drummer John Bonham.

name: Madonna
about: Madonna achieved popularity by pushing the boundaries of lyrical content in mainstream popular music and imagery in her music videos, which became a fixture on MTV

name: Ramones
about: The Ramones were an American punk rock band that formed in the New York City. They are often cited as the first band to define the punk rock sound.

name: Rolling Stones
about: The Rolling Stones are an English rock band formed in London in 1962.

name: Bob Marley
about: Jamaican reggae singer, songwriter, musician, and guitarist who achieved international fame and acclaim.

name: Beastie Boys
about: Beastie Boys were an American hip hop band from New York City.

name: Otis Redding
about: One of the greatest of all time.

name: Velvet Underground
about: One of the greatest of all time.

name: Tupac Shakur
about: Tupac Amaru Shakur, also known by his stage names 2Pac and Makaveli, was an American rapper, songwriter, and actor.

name: Aretha Franklin
about: Aretha Louise Franklin is an American singer and musician...with an incredible set of pipes.

name: Myster
about: You Found the Duplicate

name: Elvis
about: The King of Rock and Roll.

name: Beatles
about: The Beatles were an English rock band, formed in Liverpool in 1960. They became widely regarded as the greatest and most influential act of the rock era.

name: AC/DC
about: Aussie band taking over the world

name: Sex Pistols
about: The Sex Pistols were an English punk rock band formed in London in 1975.

name: Dr.Dre
about: An influential American record producer, rapper and entrepreneur.

name: Pink Floyd
about: Considered one of the greatst rock groups of all time.

name: The Clash
about: The Clash were an English punk rock band that formed in 1976 as part of the original wave of British punk. Along with punk, their music incorporated elements of reggae, dub, funk, and rockabilly.

name: U2
about: Ireland's greatest rock export.
